description: China has the firepower to end its housing crisis at a high-stakes policy meeting, including with a “big-bang solution” that involves pumping money like the Federal Reserve. But it’s unlikely to pull the trigger.
title: How Xi Can Surprise World With Big-Bang Moves at China Plenum

description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer is open to replacing Joe Biden as Democrats’ nominee amid concerns about the president’s mental acuity, Axios reports.
title: Schumer Open to Replacing Biden as Nominee, Axios Reports

description: Emmanuel Macron’s main partner in a proposal to deploy military trainers to Ukraine cast doubt on its prospects after the French president was left weakened by his country’s recent elections.
title: Macron’s Plan to Send Trainers to Ukraine Falters After Election

description: Keir Starmer said the overcrowding crisis in UK prisons was his main domestic priority and signaled the “terrible state” of public services left by Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives meant unpopular decisions were unavoidable.
title: Starmer Says ‘Shocking’ Prisons Are the UK’s Most Urgent Crisis

description: Canada said it will begin the process of buying a fleet of submarines that will likely boost its defense spending to meet NATO targets, as Prime Minister Justin Trudeau attempts to defuse criticism from allies.
title: Canada Plans to Buy Submarines, Inching Closer to NATO Defense Target

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, national security reporter Daniel Flatley looks at how President Joe Biden’s political troubles are playing at the NATO summit in Washington. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: NATO Leaders Praise Biden While Courting Trump Allies

description: New York Lieutenant Governor Antonio Delgado, one of the state’s most prominent Democrats, called on Joe Biden to step aside Wednesday, becoming the latest elected official to call for the president to end his reelection bid.
title: New York’s Lieutenant Governor Urges Biden to End Reelection Bid

description: Kyiv wants to convene a second meeting to achieve a fair peace settlement in Ukraine before the US elections in November, this time with Russia attending, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Ukraine Seeks New Summit With Russia Ahead of US Elections

description: Italy is working to clinch a land border agreement between Lebanon and Israel in an effort to de-escalate tensions between the two countries, according to Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani.
title: Italy Seeks to Broker a Land Border Deal With Israel, Lebanon

description: Joe Biden managed to reassure NATO leaders about his fitness for office with a strong speech at the opening of the alliance’s 75th anniversary summit, but it wasn’t enough to quiet growing doubts about his chance of winning reelection in November.
title: NATO Allies Gloomy on Biden’s Prospects Seek Out Trump Circle

description: Australia, one of the world’s last major nuclear power holdouts, is debating a pivot that could see the country end its decades-long resistance to the energy source.
title: One of The Last Holdouts, Australia Weighs Nuclear Power Pivot

description: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said she won’t put herself forward to be the Greens’ pick for chancellor at the next election, paving the way for Robert Habeck to be the party’s candidate.
title: Germany’s Baerbock Says She Won’t Run as Greens Chancellor Candidate

description: Senate Democrats will meet Thursday with senior advisers to Joe Biden as divisions persist within the party about the 81-year-old president’s candidacy.
title: Top Biden Aides to Brief Divided Senate Democrats on Thursday

description: US Senator Bob Menendez’s lawyer told jurors that the politician’s wife failed to tell him details of how she got a Mercedes Benz from a convicted felon who testified during the lawmaker’s corruption trial that the car was a bribe.
title: Menendez Wife Hid Truth About Car Given by Felon, Lawyer Says

description: Portugal plans to increase the amount of military aid it’s providing to Ukraine this year to €221 million ($239 million), Prime Minister Luis Montenegro said.
title: Portugal Will Increase Military Aid to Ukraine to €221 Million

description: France has become ungovernable after the snap legislative elections left the country with a deeply divided parliament and no obvious path toward a stable government, according to three-quarters of respondents in a poll by Elabe.
title: Most French Say Country Is ‘Ungovernable’ After Vote, Poll Shows

description: Argentina’s president, Javier Milei, warned voters on the campaign trail last fall that the “shock therapy” he would use to stabilize the country’s serially ailing economy would be painful, and his prediction has come true. Consumer price inflation has accelerated since Milei took office on Dec. 10: Prices are up more than 100% through May — and 276% from a year earlier — after he scrapped price controls, devalued the currency and started to cut some subsidies that held down prices for transport
title: Milei’s Economic Overhaul Faces These Four Hurdles

description: Romania said it’s negotiating with the US and other NATO partners to receive an additional Patriot system after donating one of two operational batteries to neighboring Ukraine.
title: Romania Seeks New Patriot System From US After Ukraine Donation

description: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi declined to support President Joe Biden’s intention to seek reelection, saying instead that it remains his decision to make — the latest signal of unease among Democrats over the incumbent’s age and ability to defeat Republican Donald Trump in November.
title: Pelosi Says Biden, Who Insists He’ll Run, Must Make Decision

description: NATO leaders are set to issue the alliance’s strongest-ever language calling out China’s military support for Russia, people familiar with the matter said, amid signs that Beijing is developing an attack drone for the conflict with Ukraine.
title: NATO Set to Call Out China Over Support for Russia’s War Machine

description: From Ukraine to the Middle East, the Patriot air defense system is having a moment: a reliable American weapon downing enemy threats. But that’s also driving demand for missiles that the US defense industry is struggling to meet.
title: Patriot’s Battlefield Success Spotlights Missile Supply Crunch

description: He wrote in a New York Times opinion piece that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.
title: George Clooney, Biden Supporter and Fundraiser, Asks President to Leave Race

description: Harvard University said it hired a new general counsel who previously worked at Northrop Grumman Corp. and the US Department of Defense, at a time when the institution faces intense scrutiny over its policies toward antisemitism and has faced calls from some students to cut financial ties with military contractors.
title: Harvard Taps Weapons Maker for Top Lawyer After Wave of Lawsuits

description: Chile reached an agreement with the US to allow a key battery component to count toward tax credits under the US Inflation Reduction Act, boosting the appeal of investing in the South American nation.
title: Chile Wins US Tax-Credit Treatment for Battery Component Made From Lithium

description: President Emmanuel Macron called on parties that represent “republican forces” to build a broad majority from the political center after snap elections left France with a divided parliament and no obvious path toward a stable government.
title: Macron Calls for Broad Majority to Shut Out Far Left, Far Right

description: Germany’s ruling coalition has agreed on a compromise proposal to strip Huawei Technologies Co. components from the nation’s 5G core mobile network by the end of 2026 for national security reasons.
title: Germany Agrees to Strip Huawei From 5G Core Network by End-2026

description: McGill University temporarily closed its main campus in Montreal as it seeks to evict pro-Palestinian protesters who have been camped out there for more than two months.
title: Canada’s McGill Shuts Campus to End Months-Long Protest Over Gaza

description: Iran’s newly elected President Masoud Pezeshkian is set to name Abbas Araghchi as foreign minister, the Tasnim news agency reported, bringing the chief negotiator on the 2015 nuclear deal into the heart of government.
title: Iran President Eyes Nuclear-Deal Broker For Top Diplomat: Tasnim

description: Israel and the Lebanon-based Hezbollah militant group have been exchanging near-daily fire along the Israel-Lebanon border since Oct. 8. The US and France are attempting to broker a diplomatic solution that would end the fighting. Should those negotiations fail, Israeli officials anticipate a full-blown war with the Iran-backed militia.
title: Can Israel’s Air Defenses Withstand All-Out War With Hezbollah?

description: Americans are naturally curious about the health of their president, and any sign of illness or frailty gets subjected to intense public scrutiny. That was not always the case. The US presidency has a checkered history with truth and disclosure when it comes to infirmity and maladies. Yet President Joe Biden’s poor debate performance on June 27 with former President Donald Trump — which has unleashed concerns among Democrats about his ability to win reelection, let alone serve another term — has
title: What US Presidents Do and Don’t Say About Their Health

description: Israel told all Palestinians in Gaza City to leave immediately, as a new phase of fighting intensified in what used to be the enclave’s most populous area.
title: Israel Orders Gaza City Residents to Leave as Fighting Escalates

description: Nearly two dozen NATO countries will pledge this week to speed up efforts to bolster Ukraine’s military and defense capabilities, even as the prospect of another Donald Trump presidency looms large over the alliance’s summit in Washington.
title: NATO Countries Seek to Bolster Ukraine’s Future Military Force

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Labour's Round Robin: Taking Stock Of The Government's Work So Far

description: South African civil rights group Freedom Under Law said it will file a court challenge against parliament’s decision to appoint a controversial former judge to serve on a body that helps select and oversee members of the judiciary.
title: South African Lawsuit Looms Over Impeached Judge’s Appointment

description: President Joe Biden’s administration will apply new tariffs to steel and aluminum shipments diverted through Mexico in a bid to prevent China from circumventing existing levies through so-called transshipment.
title: US Targets China With Tariffs on Steel, Aluminum Sent Via Mexico

description: María Corina Machado has built a powerful, energized citizen movement. How far it can ultimately go is up to Nicolás Maduro.
title: Blacklisted and Muzzled, Maduro’s Top Rival Can’t Be Held Down

description: Kenya needs about $26 billion over the next decade to pay off existing foreign debts and there are fewer options to raise that after the nation abandoned plans to increase taxes following deadly protests, analysts said.
title: Kenya on Tightrope as Options Fade to Scale $26 Billion Debt Wall

description: Russia’s war in Ukraine, which President Vladimir Putin once hoped to conclude in a few weeks, is grinding through its third year, with neither side able to gain a decisive upper hand. Bringing an end to the conflict — whether through one side’s clear victory, a messy compromise or simply a cessation of hostilities without a final deal — may hinge less on battlefield tactics than on which side exhausts its resources first. With Putin ramping up Russia’s defense production and Ukraine backed by a
title: Why Russia-Ukraine War Is So Hard to Win, and How It Might End

description: The UK’s new prime minister, Keir Starmer, said he would accelerate efforts to forge closer ties with Europe, using this week’s NATO summit and next week’s meeting of the European Political Community to make progress toward a defense and security pact between Britain and the European Union.
title: Keir Starmer Eyes Quick UK-EU Pact on Defense and Security

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: War and Trump Have NATO Feeling Its Age at 75

description: The Philippines will continue increasing defense spending as it seeks private sector’s support in safeguarding the nation’s claims in the disputed South China Sea.
title: Philippines Pushes Bigger Defense Spending as China Spat Lingers

description: Thailand’s Election Commission certified the results of the first Senate contest since a coup in 2014, paving the way for new lawmakers to join the upper house of parliament following a complex selection process last month.
title: Thailand Confirms New Senators in First Contest After 2014 Coup

description: With a new rule, the agency integrates future as well as current flood risk into standards for construction and repair projects.
title: Biden Administration Raises FEMA Bar for Flood Resilience

description: Joe Biden is turning to Black, Hispanic and progressive leaders to curb an intraparty uprising over his fitness for office, an unexpected lifeline for a president whose standing among voters in those groups has diminished.
title: Biden Looks to Black, Latino Leaders to Put Down Party Uprising

description: China is investigating whether the European Union’s recent tariffs and actions against the world’s No. 2 economy constitute a barrier to free trade, underscoring tensions between the two blocs.
title: China Launches Tit-for-Tat Investigation Into EU Trade Barriers

description: Thailand’s plan to reclassify cannabis as a narcotic just two years after its historic decriminalization sends the wrong signal to foreign investors, the second-biggest party in the ruling coalition warned.
title: Thai Cannabis U-Turn to Hurt Investor Confidence, Key Party Says

description: The US had a largely more favorable image than China in 35 high- and middle-income countries surveyed by the Pew Research Center, showing Beijing’s effort to win hearts and minds globally still has a ways to go.
title: US Favored Over China in Dozens of Countries, Pew Survey Says

description: Malaysia said it’s near a deal with Singapore to develop Southeast Asia’s first cross-border special economic zone, which the countries hope will lure new investment and spur growth.
title: Malaysia Says Near Singapore Deal for Special Economic Zone

description: German Vice Chancellor Robert Habeck said he wants to prevent China from gaining control over wind-turbine data.
title: Germany to Prevent China Control of Wind-Turbine Data, Habeck Says

description: The head of France’s Medef business lobby said the program of the alliance of left-wing parties, which won the most seats in this months parliamentary elections, are a danger to the economy.
title: French Business Group Calls Left’s Plan Danger to Economy, Echos Reports

description: Keir Starmer signaled Ukraine can use Britain’s Storm Shadow missiles to strike military targets inside Russia, confirming he would continue the previous UK government’s policy on the use of its long-range weapons in the Russia-Ukraine war.
title: Starmer Says Ukraine Can Use UK Missiles to Strike Inside Russia

description: Eastern European governments from Prague to Sofia have grand plans to build new plants, but the question is who will pay for them.
title: €130 Billion Nuclear Dream in Europe Meets Financial Reality

description: Firms are increasingly paying up for a service that offers — but doesn’t guarantee — a better planning approval process
title: UK Homebuilders Splash Cash in Bid to Bypass Busted Planning System

description: US paper makers are warning the European Union that a new law requiring them to trace timber to its origins risks disrupting $3.5 billion of trade and raising prices for diapers, sanitary pads and other hygiene products.
title: US Diaper Makers Warn EU of Shortages Under Law to Save Forests

description: One of the most influential people attending the NATO summit leads a country that is not a member. Yet it holds vast stores of weapons sought by the bloc to help Ukraine fight off Russia, and perhaps tip the battle in Kyiv’s favor.
title: South Korea’s Ability to Arm Ukraine Elevates Its Role at NATO Summit

description: China’s consumer prices eked out another small gain in June, hovering near zero for a fifth month, a sign that deflationary pressures continue to impede an economic recovery.
title: China Consumer Prices Inch Up But Deflation Pressure Lingers

description: Donald Trump injected reality television-level drama into his Miami rally, repeatedly teasing — but stopping short of announcing — Florida Senator Marco Rubio as a running mate as he seeks to draw maximum attention to his vice presidential selection.
title: Trump Teases Marco Rubio at Miami Rally as VP Announcement Nears

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy urged NATO allies to act decisively in helping his country repel Russia’s invasion instead of “waiting for November” in an oblique reference to the US presidential election.
title: Zelenskiy Urges NATO to Help Kyiv Now, Before the US Election

description: The Russian president is on a whirl of diplomatic engagement, confounding Western efforts to present him as isolated over the war in Ukraine.
title: Putin Is Meeting a Lot of World Leaders for a Global ‘Outcast’
